description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dor3m","text":"Description and benefits of post-weaning “Enriched Rat Housing” used in conjunction with various experiments ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkdb4","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bqch9","text":"In \"standard\" housing, after weaning, rats are housed in same-sex pairs in clear plastic laboratory cages (42 × 22 × 20 cm) lined with bedding (Aspen Shavings).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kcvc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"okb5","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4crfj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5F26C7D0CFB511ECB31EB7D91A1FC7DA","height":256.57309659090896,"id":274610,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-09 at 9.30.36 AM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/infwbqymf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/infubqymf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/infvbqymf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inftbqymf.webp","width":219.46376846811802}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gtk8","text":"The environmentally enriched home cage consists of a large metal wire cage (90 × 60 × 120 cm; Doctors Forrest and Smith, Rhinelander, WI) with four levels connected by three ramps, each level containing a removable tray with bedding (Aspen Shavings) at the bottom.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rs3d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h77g","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1cnba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"92FDCF60038E11EDB78DF19D3ABABB1D","height":435,"id":274614,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"EE cage.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inf2bsf3p.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/infybsf3p.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/infzbsf3p.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/infxbsf3p.webp","width":326.25}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"88cq0","text":"Rearing rats in the enrichment cage has the following potential benefits.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kegd","text":"The standard laboratory cage has a total volume of approximately 18,500 cm3 of cage space. When two rats are housed together, the space per rat is only 9,250 cm3. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":74,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":160,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3g973","text":"The standard housing restricts the animal's physical movement. For example. when the lid is on, adult rats cannot rear to their maximum height.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bl9m7","text":"The animal's social interaction is limited to that with a single cage mate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"82v2","text":"Approximately 15 plastic or wooden shelters and pet toys (e.g., huts, ladders, ropes, running wheels, bells, etc.; Doctors Forrest and Smith) are placed inside the cage, which allows animals to play, exercise, and explore.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e27fr","text":"  \n    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":3,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":5,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7D430EB0037F11EDB78DF19D3ABABB1D","height":228.87272727272702,"id":274618,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bhth1","text":"The top half of the cage provides ladders, platforms, ropes, and wooden shelters where the rats are able to hide, climb,  and gnaw on.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-09 at 9.36.42 AM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inf6bsf3p.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inf4bsf3p.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inf5bsf3p.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inf3bsf3p.webp","width":324.43298969072146}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"998C92D0037F11EDB78DF19D3ABABB1D","height":219.85818181818172,"id":274622,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cviq4","text":"The bottom half of the cage also has ladders, platforms, shelters as well as running wheels for exercise.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-09 at 9.37.49 AM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ingabsf3p.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inf8bsf3p.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inf9bsf3p.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inf7bsf3p.webp","width":328.59239130434776}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d96lc","text":"After weaning, up to 16 rats are housed together in a single enrichment cage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fefla","text":"The bedding is changed and the plastic trays and objects are cleaned once a week. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ffd97","text":"Cages are kept in a temperature (22 ± 1 °C) and humidity (55 %) controlled colony maintained on a reverse light/dark cycle (lights on from 1900 to 0700 h).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8j8kc","text":"Enrichment cages are kept in a temperature (22 ± 1 °C) and humidity (55 %) controlled colony maintained on a reverse light/dark cycle (lights on from 1900 to 0700 h).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cvh9j","text":"There are no objects inside the cage that can provide rats with sensory and cognitive stimulation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"72mam","text":"Animals are allowed to have social interactions with a large number of conspecifics.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"as89o","text":"Rearing rats in the enrichment cage has some potential problems.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"etmvk","text":"Social interactions with a large number of cage mates can occasionally result in conflicts among rats, and the risk of aggression is increased. Although injuries due to aggression are rarely observed possibly because there is enough space for rats to retreat and express submissive behaviors, stress associated with such conflicts could potentially affect animals' behavior.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cf7a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"44i64","text":"Rats also sometimes compete for resources such as water. However, this competition often gives way to cooperative behavior. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"627pe","text":"(1) Standard housing provides a simple and controlled environment that restricts both physical movement, sensory and cognitive stimulation, and normal social interaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1uq5u","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqk19","text":"(2) Enriched housing provides a complex environment that provides ample opportunity for movement, sensory and cognitive stimulation, and social interaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"egl0","text":"The objects and toys inside the cage provide rats with ample sensory and cognitive stimulation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ctjvo","text":"The enrichment cage provides a total volume of 648,000 cm3 of cage space, which is 35 times as much as that provided by the standard plastic cage. When 16 rats are housed together, the space provided per rat is 40,500 cm3, which is 4.38 times as much as that provided by the standard cage. Thus, animals' physical movement is unrestricted, and they are allowed to move freely within the large multi-level cage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":57,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":220,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"30eeu","text":"Certain toys such as running wheels also allow animals to have vigorous physical exercise.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"epe1s","text":"Animals have ad libitum access to food (Teklad Laboratory Diet #8604, Envigo, Indianapolis, IN) and water unless food or water restriction is required by experimental protocols. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":13,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1mnah","text":"Animals have ad libitum access to food (Teklad Laboratory Diet #8604, Envigo, Indianapolis, IN) and water unless food or water restriction is required by experimental protocols.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":13,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6k5k5","text":"Large cage space and novel objects can be initially frightening and stressful for some animals.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"19q23","text":"There is less experimental control over environmental conditions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Enriched Rat Housing
